comments.raw_text:
I can confirm we are suffering the same bug. On an ASP.Net page, we set MaintainScrollPositionOnPostback="true" so online editing of a table scrolls back to the right position when the user has scrolled away from the default top position.

This has been working fine since 2009 but began noticing the bug about 2 weeks ago during a move to a new hosting company, somewhat baffling as our code had not been changed. Further testing revealed that independent of operating system (Windows XP, Windows Vista, Mac OS Leopard, Ubuntu) Internet Explorer, Chromium and Safari handle the comman properly. It works on a version of Fx 3.6 but on Fx 7, the ScrollPosition command not handled properly.

I'm uploading a short clip of the problem in action to www.akerbeltz.org/scrollbug.avi

comments.raw_text:
Ok, we've found a solution. Turns out this is a Microsoft bug within .NET 4... they've released a fix for it (http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2600088).

After applying the hotfix, MaintainScroll works fine. I suspect it wasn't a Fx isse with Jorge either but a question of whether his host had applied the fix or not.
